newsitem.title: USA: Enron says Ore. merger agenda not a setback.
newsitem.headline: Enron says Ore. merger agenda not a setback.

text.p: Enron Corp does not view the Oregon Public Utility Commission's (OPUC) latest schedule to review the company's planned merger with Portland General Corp as a setback, an Enron spokesman said Tuesday.
"We may decide to stick with the present schedule or we may decide to formally request a pre-hearing conference. We want to keep our options open," said spokesman Gary Foster.

The Oregon commission decided Monday not to schedule such a conference ahead of a staff report on the merger slated for release on April 11, but said a pre-hearing conference could be scheduled at a later date.
The OPUC staff has already said it will advise against the merger.
The state agency's review of the merger has snagged on the issue of a rate decrease for Oregon electricity customers.
The staff of the utility commission is holding out for a post-merger rate cut of $141 million, while Enron has officially offered $61 million in ratepayer compensation.
Other dates for the review were unchanged, with a final commission decision set for June 4.
